articles.title: IMF lowers Argentina's reserves target to $8 bln as farm income hit
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) executive board lowered Argentina's net reserves accumulation target for the end of 2023 to $8 billion, the lender said on Monday, in a boost to the government's beleaguered finances. The IMF's previous reserves target was $9.8 billion.
articles.content:

articles.title: Lionel Messi and PSG sunk to a new low against Lyon - things cannot go on like this
articles.description: Jeered by fans, faltering on the field - this felt like a new low for Argentina's World Cup winner in his two seasons in Paris
articles.content:

articles.title: Teen Spent 17 Months Cycling 20,000 Miles From Alaska to Argentina
articles.description: Liam Garner, 17, set off with a bicycle, camping equipment, and $8,000, to accomplish the "most ridiculous goal" he could set for himself.
articles.content:
Liam Garner set off with a bicycle and around $8,000 to try to accomplish a "ridiculous goal."
Over 17 months, the teen cycled 20,000 miles across 14 countries, from the US to Argentina.

articles.title: Argentina to launch 'soy dollar' on Monday to aid agriculture sector
articles.description: Argentina's government will launch a new "soy dollar" preferential exchange rate for farm exports on Monday to boost agricultural shipments and increase the depleted foreign reserves in the central bank.
articles.content:
By Jorge Otaola
BUENOS AIRES, April 2 (Reuters) - Argentina's government will launch a new "soy dollar" preferential exchange rate for farm exports on Monday, a spokesperson from the economy ministry said, to boost agricultural shipments and increase... [2045 chars]

articles.title: Motorcycling-Binder 'fights like hell' to win Argentina sprint from 15th on grid
articles.description: Red Bull KTM rider Brad Binder put on a masterclass in bravery and skill to win Saturday's MotoGP sprint race at the Argentina Grand Prix after starting 15th on the grid. VR46 Racing's two Ducatis of Marco Bezzecchi and Luca Marini completed the podium, while championship leader Francesco Bagnaia, who started on the front row, could only finish sixth behind pole sitter Alex Marquez.
